{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3569003,"name":"","username":"RafaelGadelha","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/8baadc/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-26T14:09:33.683Z","cooked":"

We were facing a problem regarding fuses tripping on a module of the swerve, before we entered a playofs match a cancoder fuse that was connected to the mini PDH tripped, we changed the port and the fuse and turned it on again, when we put them in the start, in the middle of the match two fuses of the mini PDH tripped, cancoder and limeligth fuse, both were on top of the swerve q module were having problems, this module before the starts had a lock in movement with each rotation, the modulon was apparently ok, we played the games and a NEO was heating up a lot in the start in which the fuses tripped the NEO broke, which may have caused the disarming of the fuses of the mini PDH and the problem in the motor may have been thereby?

Are you sure that you aren’t causing a short somewhere? Perhaps during robot play, the wires might be slipping out and shorting with each other, blowing the fuse.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-03-26T14:18:52.274Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":78,"readers_count":77,"score":25.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":496974,"topic_slug":"we-were-facing-a-problem-regarding-fuses-tripping-on-a-module-of-the-swerve","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53274,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1672 Alum | Programming/Electrical"},"post_url":"/t/we-were-facing-a-problem-regarding-fuses-tripping-on-a-module-of-the-swerve/496974/2","custom_user_title":"1672 Alum | Programming/Electrical","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3569018,"name":"","username":"RafaelGadelha","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/8baadc/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-26T14:27:26.629Z","cooked":"

When the start was over we checked the ports and all the wires and found nothing that could cause a short circuit

If you’re mounting stuff to the top of modules are you making sure your screws for mounting those items are not so long that they interfere with the module gears or even the motor?

Photos are always helpful.

It sounds like something is assembled wrong in your module

RafaelGadelha:

this module before the starts had a lock in movement with each rotation, the modulon was apparently ok
